Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Multimodal Analgesia in VATS

Participants.evidence: adult patients undergoing VATS lung resection between March and October 2020

Intervention.evidence: Patients were divided into two groups: the opioid-sparing (OS) group receiving PVB and ketamine (n = 41), and the control group treated with postoperative morphine infusion (n = 21).

Objective.evidence: This study assesses the efficacy of a multimodal analgesia protocol combining paravertebral block (PVB) and ketamine infusion in reducing postoperative opioid consumption in patients undergoing video-assisted thoracic surgery (VATS).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the need for rescue opioid therapy within 48 hours post-surgery.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Patients were divided into two groups: the opioid-sparing (OS) group receiving PVB and ketamine (n = 41), and the control group treated with postoperative morphine infusion (n = 21).

Result_Outcome.evidence: Rescue opioid administration was significantly lower in the OS group (19.5% vs. 47.6%, p = 0.021).

Harms.evidence: No differences in haemodynamics or ketamine/PVB-related complications were reported.
